1.text: A soft answer turneth away fury; but a grievous word stirreth up anger.

2.text: The tongue of the wise useth knowledge aright; but the mouth of the foolish poureth out folly.

3.text: The eyes of Jehovah are in every place, beholding the evil and the good.

4.text: Gentleness of tongue is a tree of life; but crookedness therein is a breaking of the spirit.

5.text: A fool despiseth his fatherâ€™s instruction; but he that regardeth reproof becometh prudent.

6.text: In the house of a righteous [man] is much treasure; but in the revenue of a wicked [man] is disturbance.

7.text: The lips of the wise disperse knowledge, but not so the heart of the foolish.

8.text: The sacrifice of the wicked is an abomination to Jehovah; but the prayer of the upright is his delight.

9.text: The way of a wicked [man] is an abomination to Jehovah; but him that pursueth righteousness he loveth.

10.text: Grievous correction is for him that forsaketh the path; he that hateth reproof shall die.

11.text: Sheol and destruction are before Jehovah; how much more then the hearts of the children of men!

12.text: A scorner loveth not one that reproveth him; he will not go unto the wise.

13.text: A joyful heart maketh a cheerful countenance; but by sorrow of heart the spirit is broken.

14.text: The heart of an intelligent [man] seeketh knowledge; but the mouth of the foolish feedeth on folly.

15.text: All the days of the afflicted are evil; but a cheerful heart is a continual feast.

16.text: Better is little with the fear of Jehovah than great store and disquietude therewith.

17.text: Better is a meal of herbs where love is, than a fatted ox and hatred therewith.

18.text: A furious man stirreth up contention; but he that is slow to anger appeaseth strife.

19.text: The way of the sluggard is as a hedge of thorns; but the path of the upright is made plain.

20.text: A wise son maketh a glad father; but a foolish man despiseth his mother.

21.text: Folly is joy to him that is void of sense; but a man of understanding regulateth his walk.

22.text: Without counsel purposes are disappointed; but in the multitude of counsellors they are established.

23.text: A man hath joy by the answer of his mouth; and a word in its season, how good is it!

24.text: The path of life is upwards for the wise, that he may depart from Sheol beneath.

25.text: Jehovah plucketh up the house of the proud; but he establisheth the boundary of the widow.

26.text: The thoughts of the evil [man] are an abomination to Jehovah; but pure words are pleasant.

27.text: He that is greedy of gain troubleth his own house; but he that hateth gifts shall live.

28.text: The heart of a righteous [man] studieth to answer; but the mouth of the wicked poureth out evil things.

29.text: Jehovah is far from the wicked; but he heareth the prayer of the righteous.

30.text: That which enlighteneth the eyes rejoiceth the heart; good tidings make the bones fat.

31.text: The ear that heareth the reproof of life shall abide among the wise.

32.text: He that refuseth instruction despiseth his own soul; but he that heareth reproof getteth sense.

33.text: The fear of Jehovah is the discipline of wisdom, and before honour [goeth] humility.
